title: Forgiving Street Principles
summary: Intersections were redesigned with raised zebra crossings, tighter curb radii, and protected cycle tracks to follow “forgiving street” principles.
caption: Intersection redesign reduces impact speeds and creates safer movements.

title: 30 km/h Zones
summary: Over half of Helsinki’s urban street network now carries 30 km/h limits. The shift significantly lowered collision severity.
caption: 30-km/h zones form the backbone of Helsinki’s Vision Zero strategy.

title: Speed Cameras
summary: Helsinki expanded the use of fixed automated speed cameras to stabilize traffic speeds and reduce high-end speeding.
caption: Fixed speed cameras on Ring Road I helped reduce excessive speeding.

title: Income-Based Fines
summary: Finland’s unique “day-fine” model ties traffic penalties directly to personal income, creating a strong deterrent against dangerous driving.
caption: Income-based fines make high-risk speeding financially consequential.

title: Pedestrian Safety
summary: Helsinki conducted a citywide audit to identify hazardous pedestrian crossings. Dangerous points were removed, relocated, or redesigned.
caption: Citywide audits helped eliminate unsafe pedestrian crossings.

title: Cycling Infrastructure
summary: Helsinki invested heavily in separated cycling corridors and high-frequency public transport. Reduced car dependency lowers overall exposure.
caption: Mode shift reduces car volumes and creates safer environments.

title: School Zone Safety
summary: School-area slow zones, raised crossings and protected bike infrastructure prioritize society’s most vulnerable road users.
caption: Children and active travelers are central to road-safety design.

title: Enforcement Against Impaired Driving
summary: Extensive random breath tests and targeted operations ensure high detection probability for impaired driving.
caption: Random breath-test campaigns contribute to low levels of impaired driving.

title: Data-Driven Analysis
summary: Systematic black-spot identification using long-term crash data is followed by prioritized engineering interventions.
caption: Crash data informs where the city invests first.
